name: The Merrovore and the Glaring Pylon
tagline: Forlorn tracks and fern-filled glades, dotted with milk-white, climbing vines.

procedural.encounter_notes: Encounters are 2-in-6 likely to be with the merrovore
procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 2d6 portions of the climbing vine known as Black Clover, in addition to the normal results

description: Forlorn tracks and fern-filled glades, dotted with milk-white, climbing vines. Any who wander through this hex come across piles of bloody, writhing tentacles in the shapes of people or animals. These wretched things are all that remains of those who have met the merrovore. The things seem vaguely alive, but do not move of their own accord, apart from the writhing.

points_of_interest.name: Tentacle Heaps
points_of_interest.description: Piles of bloody, writhing tentacles in the shapes of people or animals. These wretched things are all that remains of those who have met the merrovore. The things seem vaguely alive, but do not move of their own accord, apart from the writhing.

points_of_interest.name: The Lair of the Merrovore
points_of_interest.description: A pool of viscous, black fluid, almost completely opaque, about 20′ wide and 12′ deep. The merrovore comes to this pool to sleep, submerging itself completely in the fluid. There is a 2-in-6 chance it is present when the pool is discovered.
points_of_interest.interior: The merrovore guards a 2′ cube of black metal, at the bottom of the pool. If touched by an arcane spell-caster, the cube opens, revealing 72 tourmalines (100gp each), a set of three spell books (Rank 1 Firelight, Glyph of Sealing, Rank 2 Perceive the Invisible, Phantasm, Rank 3 Dispel Magic, Lightning Bolt, Rank 4 Dimension Door), and a black silk robe that acts as a Cloak of Displacement.
secrets: Black metal cube with treasure at bottom of pool

points_of_interest.name: The Glaring Pylon
points_of_interest.description: A gargantuan, granite pylon stands amid a tangle of blackthorn and brambles. The pylon is square, 100 yards high, and 10 yards across at the base. At the top of the pylon (invisible from the forest floor) are carved four horrid eyes (one per side), glaring out at the sky.
points_of_interest.interior: This is the locus of Hasturiel Thrice-Crowned, a deity of the witches who dwells in inaccessible caverns deep beneath the pylon.
special_features: 2-in-6 chance of 1d6 Witches conducting ritual on any given night
On solstices and equinoxes: pylon blazes with blue flame and 4d6 Witches worship here
secrets: Hasturiel Thrice-Crowned dwells in caverns beneath

npcs.name: The Merrovore
npcs.description: A lithe, deer-like body (10′ tall to the shoulder), covered in shaggy, white fur, with cat-like paws and a seven-thonged tail. In its face is a single, crazed eye—deep red—and a slavering, toothed maw. The merrovore stalks the wood in this hex, gurgling and mumbling, tracking by scent.
npcs.stat_reference: Level 8 AC 14 HP 43 Saves D8 R9 H10 B11 S12, Att Bite (+7, 2d6) and 2 claws (+7, 1d6) and tail whip (+7, 1d8) Speed 60 Morale 10 XP 1,440

items.name: Black Metal Cube Treasure
items.description: 72 tourmalines (100gp each), a set of three spell books (Rank 1 Firelight, Glyph of Sealing, Rank 2 Perceive the Invisible, Phantasm, Rank 3 Dispel Magic, Lightning Bolt, Rank 4 Dimension Door), and a black silk robe that acts as a Cloak of Displacement

secrets: The glaring eyes at the top of the pylon cause blindness: Save Versus Spell or be struck blind for 1d6 days
Witches bound to Hasturiel are immune to the pylon's gaze
On solstices and equinoxes, touching the flaming pylon grants Polymorph ability for 24 hours
Hasturiel Thrice-Crowned dwells in inaccessible caverns deep beneath the pylon
dm_notes: Ley line Ywyr: Arcane spell-casters perceive the distant moaning of the dead. The merrovore attacks all it encounters except witches, whom it cannot see or smell. Anyone surprised by the merrovore automatically meets its gaze. In melee, unless averting eyes, characters meet its gaze each Round (Save Versus Hold or be transformed into writhing tentacles - fatal). Averting eyes gives -4 penalty to Attack Rolls and merrovore gains +2 bonus.
